website_summaries.verdict: A fun-to-use lens system, the Lensbaby Spark's low price makes it a great add-on for entry-level dSLR users who want to try their hands at special effects sans filters.
pros: The Lensbaby Spark is a cheap, entertaining way to do special effects the old-fashioned way
cons: Areas of focus aren't extremely sharp when viewed at full size

website_summaries.verdict: The Lensbaby Spark is a fun lens that allows you to play with focus in ways that aren't possible with traditional SLR optics.
cons: Only available for Canon and Nikon

customer_reviews.title: but I can see that it will be a good tool to create some interesting looking images
customer_reviews.text: I have only used my new Spark a few times outside, but I can see that it will be a good tool to create some interesting looking images. It is limited due to the fixed aperture 5.6, but for the price it's a fun lens to use.
customer_reviews.author: eppelsauce

customer_reviews.title: Great "toy" lens for Lomo-style
customer_reviews.text: If your expectation is to get some weird Lomo style from this cheap lens, you will be very happy. It's a fun, unpredictable lens to goof off with and it produces some really cool lo-fi results.
customer_reviews.author: Ohana Films

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this lens because of how fun and easy it is to use. Definitely wouldn't use it in important situations but I thoroughly enjoy messing around with it for creative purposes. I included a photo I snapped with this lens on my 5D MKII.
customer_reviews.author: MFlores

customer_reviews.title: The lens is okay, but it's advertised wrong as ...
customer_reviews.text: The lens is okay, but it's advertised wrong as though it will fit the Creative Aperture Kit 2. I later learned that you have to get the Special Edition of Lensbaby Spark (which comes with all the filters) and they magnetically fit into the front of the lens. But this regular edition won't be compatible with the creative filter disks.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Manthei

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very difficult lens to use. I have severe arthritis, and it is nearly impossible for me to manipulate because rather than a wheel or ring to adjust, one must push, pull and tilt the very stiff bellows. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Martin-Wood

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: Keeping in mind that this lens is under $100, its absolutely amazing. Its so much fun, takes a while to get the hang of but its great. Doesnt ever really focus on stuff far away, but for more close shots its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: PooperScooper11

customer_reviews.title: Not at all what I was hoping for but gave ...
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I was hoping for but gave it a try anyway out of curiosity. It's definitely for a beginner. You could get the same effect in PSP and look cleaner within a few moments of editing.
customer_reviews.author: Dream Multimedia Group

customer_reviews.title: Many improvments
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I used an older version of the lensbaby. It was cool, but not exactly easy to use. This one is a lot more ergonomic, and easy enough to hold the camera with one hand, and focus the lens with the other. It takes a little getting used to, but it's not a steep learning curve. I think it's a pretty decent value for the price. I use a Canon EOS 7D, and shoot manual exposure. I didn't have to change anything about my metering, just adjusting the shutter speed, since the fstop is fixed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mcmurray

customer_reviews.title: Unpredictable
customer_reviews.text: Not much control over the lens at all. I'm a photographer and even though I can control all the camera settings, it never really focuses right. I wonder if the more expensive versions are better? Photos with this are so hit or miss. Really only for playing around. Could never use for a client. I've debated selling it because of it's limited use.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The page reads this is for Canon. The package that arrived said Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Shoeprints

customer_reviews.title: Must have item!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to have, not really going for the tilt shift style, but does wonders for getting those shots of action, or stand alone actions. Must practice with to get the right comps, and have decent eye sight. Just the all around wonderful tool to use. Have a hard time putting it down and going back to my other lenses.
customer_reviews.author: WHAT??50k

customer_reviews.title: This is really cool. I only have one complaint and that is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really cool. I only have one complaint and that is there is some kind of plastic thing in between the bellow that makes it difficult to take pictures of things far away and get focus. I do love this though. I always wanted to play with tilt shift and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: blank

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend. He was very happy when he received it. He said he was taking it on a trip so I’m looking forward to the photos.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hitchcock

customer_reviews.title: Make shooting challenging and fun again!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best money I have spent on anything photography related in years! Its a little more challenging to use than the typical auto focus lenses but when you get it right all your pictures become works of art. Just when I was getting tired of my camera setup and getting some new gear lust, the lensbaby lit the "spark" (bad pun!) for some new creativity! Best $75 I've spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Great intro into Tilt Shift
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive way to get into tilt shift photography with out committing to a high dollar lens. While inexpensive, and a lot of plastic, it actually feels quite robust and sturdy. The optics are a little slow, aperture wise, but as an entry level tool, its a great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Rettke

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. The quality of my images was terrible. Everything was under exposed even at 6400.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester_cat

customer_reviews.title: fun lens, not really useful for anything
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, fun lens, not really useful for anything. Not for indoors, very light weight plastic, fit on a Mark 3,
customer_reviews.author: Richard carr

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor portraits
customer_reviews.text: Lensbaby Spark Lens for Canon is great for outdoor portraits, it creates a focal point in the pictures and rich colors. The lens is not good for low light conditions since the aperture is fixed at f/5.6. This lens gives you the sensation that you are responsible for the outcome since you have to do all manually and controll the focus point.
customer_reviews.author: Jason lopez

customer_reviews.title: Fun lens. This gives the stated effects
customer_reviews.text: Fun lens. This gives the stated effects, but honestly I think you can achieve more, and better, effects through software manipulation. But overall it's a fun little gadget to have in the camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Red House

customer_reviews.title: Looks like pinhole film but cleaner and you can easily and quickly compose the frame's focus
customer_reviews.text: Love getting an analog pin hole feel on my nikon 3300.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Neat Lens
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this just to try it out, but ended up keeping it because it allows me to be so much more creative at a very low cost. I would recommend anyone to try this out, it will help you hone your manual focus skills.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful new toy--still learning it, but it has been fun.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use, not very high quality, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Fun to use, not very high quality, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Photog

customer_reviews.title: Great For Art
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little lens for art or just for fun. I love the selective focus, although it can be a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fun to play with. Not a very sharp price of glass but gets some interesting video and stills.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Lensbaby Spark for Canon
customer_reviews.text: A fun and useful lens to make creative photos. I'm glad I saw it in a book and decided to buy.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cline

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to camera bag.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think much about this item except that I wanted to try an item from LensBaby that wouldn't break the bank. This was that item. For under $80 dollars you get a pretty decent lens to play with. I used it on my Canon 7D and T2si with no problems at all. You can get some great shots from it. I would recommend this for any photo bag. Fun lens to play with.
customer_reviews.author: R. Blasi

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Turns out I carry it around more than I actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: William Klipp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little getting used but can create some interesting effects faster than software processing.
customer_reviews.author: c ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: It's tough to focus if you wear glasses, but fun to play with. Honestly though, while I didn't have high expectations, I'm not super pleased with the quality. My lens appears to focus to the left of center instead of center focus. Not sure it was worth the investment, as I would definitely qualify it as a "toy" lens. Produced poor to mediocre quality photos on my Canon MkII.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new with using lens baby. but it seems to produce amazing photos when used right. I use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Arbogast

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really fun as a toy but not a serious lens.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use great shots.
customer_reviews.text: Works just like advertised. Takes a moment to get the hang of the focusing and correct ISO when using it, but fun overall. I was even able to teach a kid how to use the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney M.

customer_reviews.title: great novelty lens!
customer_reviews.text: A nifty little toy lens, gives you an inexpensive tiltshift effect, i also like using this for action shots because it conveys a nice idea of motion, I deffinatley think this is worth picking up for under 100 dollars! However this lens is not for beginners you have no exposure metering from the lens it self as well as no autofocus or apeture control so you have to guestimate the exposure however once you get used to it it is really cool to think of new ideas with it!!
customer_reviews.author: brandon barthelmas

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected.
customer_reviews.text: The quality was poor and very difficult to adjust the ISO based on ligth. If I had the chance to test in advance I will definetely saved few bucks. Not expensive but also not performing.
customer_reviews.author: Entropico

customer_reviews.title: Spark lens is fun!
customer_reviews.text: Neat lens, just getting into it. Definitely recommend this to other photographers.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Azriel

customer_reviews.title: Too fiddly to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really couldn't get any decent results from this. Ended up selling it on ebay.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Masud A. Khan

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This lens takes some getting used to, but it's fun to experiment with this lens. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Casbon

customer_reviews.title: Needs zoom
customer_reviews.text: Would be better if it was able to zoom. This is only reason I gave it a rating of four stars. Otherwise really like lens.
customer_reviews.author: Conlink

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Awesome After the Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a learning curve since I'm used to only shooting with wide f/ ranges. But I like it when I do get the focus correct! *Image attached to this review is property of Ashley Cox Photos and may not be reproduced or used without explicit written consent from Ashley Cox Photos- All rights reserved for Ashley Cox Photos*
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great, resonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, no complaints. Easy to install onto camera, easy to operate. I like the size and weight of the unit too.
customer_reviews.author: Tapio Jaakola

customer_reviews.title: Unique product, but neat
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my momma for Christmas, she enjoys the thing. Fun to play around with, a unique and quirky toy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my dad
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for Christmas for my dad. He has taken up photography over the last few years and has many "gold-ring" lenses, but has enjoyed some of the creativity that this allows. The pictures look good.
customer_reviews.author: B. Luinenburg

customer_reviews.title: Too dark
customer_reviews.text: You heve to get you pictures in a high ISO or in a very bright day. It is very hard to see where it is focused. Lost virtually 80% of the pictures I took with it. But... some are actually good and the effect is interesting. For the price, I can say it's fair.
customer_reviews.author: REGIS OQUENDO NOGUEIRA

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this lens on several occasions and it’s pointless. I’m not used to having 98 percent of my shots turn out useless! I can do WAY better with my 50mm prime and blur edges in Snapseed. I thought it would be fun but it’s just frustrating. I shoot full manual and I’m used to having control. Sending this back!
customer_reviews.author: K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: A toy very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Its good for play, is not easy focus at the begining, but after that you only enjoy. I like street photography and it add a special look for my pictures. If you are a photographer who looks for the perfection its not for you. Is a toy very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Juan P

customer_reviews.title: but I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just my particular camera body (Nikon D3200) but since you can't adjust the aperture or shutter speed while this lens is on the camera body I have to change to a different lens, choose my aperture and shutter speed, then change back to the Spark to soot each picture. I wa svery excited about it too, but I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: notb4mybeer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a sex toy
customer_reviews.text: If you have nothing of interest to shoot, this lens will make the mundane interesting. If you have a nice photo in mind, your probably not going to want to use this lens. It's fun to play with, but I'm not sure it's worth $80... But for that matter, I'm not sure spending $2,000 for a lens is worth it either.
customer_reviews.author: craptain

customer_reviews.title: Neat product, but be patient
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat lens, allowing you to take some really cool pictures. It's easy to install and use. BUT...be patient, it takes awhile to figure out how to make it take te pictures you see on the website. It's really best for spots or movement, not still shots. The movement makes the blurry part show up more. THis is a great lens to have in your bag, and good as a starter. I bought this as a gift, and I have the Lensbaby Composer for my Nikon. The Composer is a bit easier to use and has a lot more nice features (at over twice the price), but still takes time to learn to use it.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGirl

customer_reviews.title: Lensbaby is awesome
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is that it won't shoot unless you put your camera in Manual mode. My other Lensbabys will shoot in any mode.
customer_reviews.author: Myrna Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: The single aperture f/5.6 is a bit limiting though - personally would have preferred something around f/2.8. It is a fun piece of kit despite this though.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Basically, you're spending money to make bad photos. Trust me, you can make bad photos with the equipment you already have. I suppose if you're a hipster, or you're just a really bad photographer, this will give you the excuse you need to pass off bad photography as "art", but for the rest of us, it's just a waste of money. Seems well constructed. It's just a flawed premise.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Built My Hotrod

customer_reviews.title: Lensbaby
customer_reviews.text: I'm afraid I can't write a very good review on the lens itself as I haven't really used it yet. Everything else was excellent. It was well packaged. Just as it was advertised . Not one problem on that end. It's all on my side. I need to get my act together and work with it. I justify that it's winter here and below 0 and spring is coming. It was a good price.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Swift

product_meta.title: Lensbaby Spark for Canon
product_meta.description:
Style:CanonIntroducing the Spark from Lensbaby, a fun and affordable way to capture selective focus images with a digital SLR. Spark features a unique selective focus optic and a tilting lens body, allowing the aspiring amateur photographer to capture creative images in-camera that have a sweet spot of focus, surrounded by blur. Spark is a lightweight, all plastic (except for the optic, which is a multi-coated glass doublet) 50mm selective focus lens with a f/5.6 fixed aperture available for Canon and Nikon DSLRs. Spark is the perfect entry point into the Lensbaby system for photography students or newer photographers looking to expand their experiment and add a creative lens to their camera bag. Spark is compatible with the rest of the optics in the Optic Swap System, and with all Lensbaby 37mm threaded accessory lenses.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

Lensbaby Spark Description: 

Fun, expressive, creative and exhilarating - Spark is all of these things, and more. If you're a hands-on photographer always up for a little adventure, you'll find a kindred spirit in Spark. Spark is a fun way to capture unique photos with your Canon or Nikon DSLR. 

Looking to capture the magic of everyday, fleeting moments, in a way that's different and unique? Spark will ignite your imagination. 

Spark photos will have a snappy "sweet spot" or round spot of focus, surrounded by melt-in-your-mouth, beautiful blur.

Available in mounts for Canon EF (EOS) and Nikon F.



Lensbaby Spark Product Specs:

 * Focal Length: 50mm
 * Aperture: fixed f/5.6 
 * Optic: multi-coated glass doublet 
 * Focus type: manual
 * Sweet spot, selective focus lens (creates a sweet spot of focus surrounded by gradual blur)
 * Compatible with Lensbaby Optic Swap System and all Lensbaby 37mm threaded accessory lenses
 * Available for Canon and Nikon mount DSLRs
 * Minimum focusing distance: approximately 13” (33cm)
 * Maximum focusing distance: Infinity



Lensbaby Spark How-to:

Simply squeeze to focus. Tilt in any direction to move the sweet spot of focus to a different area of your image.
feature_bullets: Discover the fun in every frame with sharp focus and surprising blur at 50mm
The Spark lens lets you find your focus, hold it in place, and snap—you’ll never get the same playful image twice.
Whether portraits or street scenes, one squeeze of the flexible lens changes the way you see.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars158 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
